question_text: Which of the following accurately describe AC and DC power characteristics? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: DC flows in a single direction with constant voltage
AC alternates polarity at a defined frequency
AC is ideal for motherboard components
DC is used internally in most computer systems
AC cannot be transformed to higher voltages
correct_answer: DC flows in a single direction with constant voltage
AC alternates polarity at a defined frequency
DC is used internally in most computer systems
explanation: DC is steady and directional, used for internal components. AC alternates and can be transformed easily for distribution.
